resources.string: Use this tool to calculate whether it is profitable to rent a house for yourself or should you take a loan and buy instead
Enter details for home buy scenario
Buying a house is more profitable in this case since the cost of buying is less than cost of renting
Renting a house is more profitable in this case since the cost of renting is less than cost of buying
Investing in house is more profitable in this case since the net returns are higher than other investment
Investing in house is less profitable in this case since the net returns are lower than other investment

To understand how the cost of buying a house is calculated, consider a hypothetical scenario where you sell the house at the end of your loan period. The net cost of ownership is total of emi and downpayment cost minus the sale price of house. Also, the tax saved from interest payments is also adjusted from the cost of EMI. 

Sale price of house = Future value of house using the rate of appreciation 

Cost of EMI = Future value of all the EMIs paid 

Cost of down payment = Future value of the initial down payment 

Inflation rate is used to calculate the future value of the costs.

To calculate XIRR from the house investment, below factors are considered: 

- Expected annual appreciation of the house. 

- Loan interest rate 

- Rental income 

- Tax savings from loan interest payments 

The derivation of annualized return (XIRR) involves complex mathematical calculations.
The rate of return from the other investment is already approximated using which the future value is calculated. This can be compared directly with the returns from house investment

Cost of rent is calculated by adding all the future values of rent payments over a reference period. 

Cost of rent = Future value of all the rent payments 

To calculate the future value of the costs, average return of investment is used which was entered by you.
Use this tool to calculate to whether it is profitable to invest in a property as compared to other instrument
